factoid: Several of those present smiled at Zherkóv’s words.
Those present expected one of Zherkóv’s usual jokes.
Zherkóv’s words redounded to the glory of our arms and of the day’s work.
Those present assumed a serious expression.
Many of those present knew that Zherkóv’s words were a lie devoid of any foundation.
Prince Bagratión turned to the old colonel.
Prince Bagratión thanked all present.
All arms behaved heroically.
Infantry behaved heroically.
Cavalry behaved heroically.
Artillery behaved heroically.
Prince Bagratión asked how two guns were abandoned in the center.
Prince Bagratión did not ask about guns on the left flank.
Prince Bagratión knew that all guns on the left flank were abandoned at the very beginning of the action.
The staff officer answered that one gun was damaged.
The staff officer answered that he could not understand the other gun.
The staff officer said he was there all the time giving orders.
The staff officer said he had just left.
The staff officer said it was hot there.
Captain Túshin was bivouacking close to the village.
Captain Túshin had already been sent for.
Prince Bagratión asked Prince Andrew if he was there.
The staff officer said they only just missed one another.
The staff officer smiled to Bolkónski.
Prince Andrew said he had not the pleasure of seeing the staff officer.
All were silent.
Captain Túshin appeared at the threshold.
Captain Túshin made his way timidly from behind the backs of the generals.
Captain Túshin stepped past the generals in the crowded hut.
Captain Túshin felt embarrassed by the sight of his superiors.
Captain Túshin did not notice the staff of the banner.
Captain Túshin stumbled over the staff of the banner.
Several of those present laughed.
Prince Bagratión asked how a gun was abandoned.
Prince Bagratión was frowning.
Prince Bagratión was frowning not so much at the captain but at those who were laughing.
Zherkóv laughed loudest among those laughing.
When confronted by stern authorities, guilt and disgrace of having lost two guns and yet remaining alive presented themselves to Captain Túshin.
Captain Túshin had been so excited that he had not thought about it until that moment.
The officers’ laughter confused Captain Túshin.
Captain Túshin stood before Prince Bagratión with his lower jaw trembling.
Captain Túshin could hardly mutter: "I don’t know your excellency I had no men."
The speaker said "You might have taken some from the covering troops."
Captain Túshin did not say there were no covering troops.
The covering troops existed.
Captain Túshin was afraid of getting some other officer into trouble.
Captain Túshin silently fixed his eyes on Prince Bagratión.
Captain Túshin looked at Prince Bagratión as a schoolboy who has blundered looks at an examiner.
The silence lasted some time.
Prince Bagratión found nothing to say.
The others did not venture to intervene.
Prince Andrew looked at Captain Túshin from under his brows.
Prince Andrew’s fingers twitched nervously.
Prince Andrew addressed the speaker as "Your excellency!".
Prince Andrew said the speaker was pleased to send him to Captain Túshin’s battery.
Prince Andrew said he went there.
Prince Andrew said he found two thirds of the men and horses knocked out.
Prince Andrew said he found two guns smashed.
Prince Andrew said he found no supports at all.
Prince Bagratión looked at Bolkónski.
Captain Túshin looked at Bolkónski.
Bolkónski spoke with suppressed agitation.

The speaker said "And, if your excellency will allow me to express my opinion, we owe today’s success chiefly to the action of that battery and the heroic endurance of Captain Túshin and his company."
Prince Andrew rose and left the table.
Prince Bagratión looked at Captain Túshin.
Prince Bagratión was reluctant to show distrust in Bolkónski’s opinion.
Prince Bagratión was not feeling able fully to credit Bolkónski’s opinion.
Prince Bagratión bent his head.
Prince Bagratión told Captain Túshin that he could go.
Prince Andrew went out with Captain Túshin.
Captain Túshin said "Thank you; you saved me, my dear fellow!".
Prince Andrew gave Captain Túshin a look.
Prince Andrew said nothing.
Prince Andrew went away.
Prince Andrew felt sad and depressed.
The situation was all so strange.
The situation was unlike what Prince Andrew had hoped.
